thread.title: Iowa Poll: Carson Takes Double-Digit Lead over Trump
thread.title_full: Iowa Poll: Carson Takes Double-Digit Lead over Trump

author: jpupdates
title: Iowa Poll: Carson Takes Double-Digit Lead over Trump
text:
Share 
Things are getting a little dicey in Iowa. 
Republican Ben Carson has taken a double-digit lead over Donald Trump, according to a new Manmouth University Poll. 
The poll of likely Iowa Republican caucus goers tops out with Ben Carson at 32 percent, followed by Donald Trump at 18 percent. 
In their last poll of GOP caucus goers in August, the two were tied for the top spot at 23 percent each, but the neurosurgeon has managed to surge to the top of the polls in Iowa. 
Both Trump and Carson are well ahead of the next tier of candidates, including: Ted Cruz and Marco Rubio at 10 percent; Jeb Bush at 8 percent; Carly Fiorina at 5 percent; Rand Paul at 3 percent and Mike Huckabee, John Kasich and Bobby Jindal at 2 percent. None of the other five candidates managed to top 1 percent. 
The business mogul is rarely at a loss of words, but admitted “I don’t know what’s going on” when confronted about Ben Carson’s surge to the top of the Iowa polls last week. 
In comparison to two months ago, both Carson and Rubio are up by 9 and 6 points, respectively. Trump has dropped by 5 points, with Fiorina’s share of the vote also plummeting by 5 points. 
Carson’s support continues to climb among all ideological groups. He now leads Trump by 9 points among very conservative voters compared to a single point two months ago, and by 21 points among somewhat conservative voters compared to 2 points in August. He also has a 17-point lead among moderate to liberal voters, which is a reversal since the prior poll when he trailed Trump by 9 points among this group. Print Friendly 10/26/2015 2:24 PM by jpupdates
